alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 21 at 9:39PM MDT until May 22 at 12:15AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL CHEYENNE AND NORTHWESTERN WALLACE COUNTIES... At 939 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Weskan. Highway 40 will be impacted. All secondary roadways will be affected. This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Creek, Lake Creek, Pond Creek, Ladder Creek, South Fork Lake Creek, Eagletail Creek, Goose Creek, Smoky Hill, Smoky Hill River and Big Timber Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
